title: The classic cars being converted to electric vehicles
description: Historic cars are being retrofitted with recycled electric motors and batteries.

title: Ron DeSantis v Biden: A bitter battle in Florida over vaccines
description: As cities begin imposing mask and vaccination mandates, a debate rages over personal freedoms.

title: The Afghan children hiding under moving lorries
description: Aged as young as seven or eight, they're risking their lives to smuggle small items over national borders.

title: Sons of Mocímboa: Mozambique’s terrorism crisis
description: Africa Eye investigates how a secretive insurgency has turned Mozambique into Southern Africa’s latest terrorism hotspot.

title: Life at sea by world's largest offshore wind farm in North Sea
description: Fancy a job with great sea views? Meet the engineers who maintain 174 turbines in the North Sea.

title: Ethiopia Tigray crisis: From monk to soldier - how war has split a church
description: The war in northern Ethiopia has caused deep divisions in the country's largest religious community.

title: Mohamed Salah: Alan Shearer eulogises over brilliant solo goal for Liverpool against Manchester City
description: Match of the Day 2's Alan Shearer and Jermaine Jenas analyse Liverpool's goals against Manchester City, including an outstanding solo effort from Mohamed Salah.

title: Manchester City complain to Liverpool about fan allegedly spitting at member of staff
description: Manchester City make a complaint to Liverpool after alleging a home fan spat at their backroom staff during the 2-2 draw at Anfield.

title: Pandora Papers: Your guide to nine years of finance leaks
description: What have been the major financial disclosures and what action has been taken?

title: Pandora Papers: Blairs saved £312,000 stamp duty in property deal
description: The ex-PM and his wife did not have to pay the tax as they bought the company that owned the house.

title: Pandora Papers: Secret wealth and dealings of world leaders exposed
description: The offshore dealings of presidents, prime ministers and royalty feature in the Pandora Papers.

title: Westward Ho! van couple narrowly escape 22ft fall
description: The couple were working in the back of their van when it rolled towards a 22ft (7m) drop.

title: Jepkosgei and Lemma win London Marathon titles in rapid times
description: Joyciline Jepkosgei takes world-record holder Brigid Kosgei's London Marathon title as the full-scale race returns.

title: Islamic State: Canadian accused of being 'voice behind the violence'
description: Canadian Mohammed Khalifa, who narrated IS videos, played a key propaganda role, prosecutors say.

title: UK to Norway sub-sea green power cable operational
description: The 450-mile (725km) cable connects Blyth in Northumberland with the Norwegian village of Kvilldal.

title: Conservative conference: Boris Johnson refuses to rule out further tax rises
description: The PM says he is a "zealous opponent" of high taxes, but warns Covid hit the UK like a "fiscal meteorite".

title: Sarah Everard murder: We'll stop at nothing to jail more rapists - PM
description: Boris Johnson also says women should have confidence in the police after the murder of Sarah Everard.

title: Bernard Tapie: French tycoon, 78, died peacefully, his family said
description: The businessman, politician and sports club owner was one of France's most recognisable figures.

title: ICYMI: An eerie sculpture and quintuplet cubs
description: Here's a look at some of the stories you may have missed this week.

title: Watford sack manager Munoz after 10 months in job
description: Watford sack manager Xisco Munoz after 10 months in the job, with the club saying "recent performances strongly indicate a negative trend".

title: Jurgen Klopp: Liverpool manager says vaccine is 'not a limit on freedom'
description: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp says he does not understand why some people refuse the coronavirus vaccine.

title: No 'uncontrolled immigration' to solve shortages
description: The prime minister says the "big lever marked uncontrolled immigration" will not be pulled to solve the driver shortfall.

title: Hug & Schar win London wheelchair titles in record times
description: Switzerland's Marcel Hug and Manuela Schar both set course records as they win the men's and women's London Marathon wheelchair races.

title: Andy Burnham: I'm not after Starmer's job
description: Greater Manchester mayor Andy Burnham says he is not going after the job of Labour leader, Sir Keir Starmer.

title: Mountain challenge: Will Renwick runs 189 Welsh peaks
description: Will Renwick began his trek to run up and down 189 peaks over 2,000ft a month ago.

title: La Palma: New eruptions from the island's volcano
description: Two new vents are causing further eruptions from the Cumbre Vieja volcano on the island of La Palma.

title: Women's Tour of Britain: Lizzie Deignan and Joss Lowden set to compete
description: Lizzie Deignan will finally get the chance to defend her 2019 Women's Tour of Britain title as the race returns for the first time in two years.

title: Fight cancellation doesn't seem real - Eubank Jr
description: Chris Eubank Jr says the cancellation of his fight is "surreal" after it was called off due to medical concerns for his opponent Anatoli Muratov.

title: Two arrests made after Bristol drink-spiking video
description: The arrest was made after a video showing the alleged spiking was posted on social media.

title: Knife Crime: Should police post pictures of knives online?
description: Campaigners say posting such photos on social media accounts does more harm than good.

title: The Papers: Couzens a Commons guard, and PM to cut red list
description: The mounting questions facing police following Wayne Couzens' conviction continues to dominate the papers.
